get.description: Welcome endpoint.
Health check endpoint to verify the service is running.
Retrieve a paginated list of projects.

post.description: Create a new project.

get.description: Get a specific project by its ID.

delete.description: Delete a project.

post.description:
Establish a RESOLVES_TENSION relationship from a Project to a Tension.
This indicates that the Project was created to resolve the specified Tension.

schema.title: Response Add Tension To Resolve Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Resolves Tension  Tension Id  Post

delete.description: Remove the RESOLVES_TENSION relationship between a Project and a Tension.

get.description: Get all Tensions that are being resolved by a specific Project.

post.description: Assign a Resource to a Project with relationship properties as defined in TRM Ontology V3.2.

schema.title: Response Assign Resource To Project Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Resources  Resource Id  Post

put.description: Update the relationship properties between a Resource and a Project.

schema.title: Response Update Resource Project Relationship Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Resources  Resource Id  Put

delete.description: Remove the ASSIGNED_TO_PROJECT relationship between a Resource and a Project.

get.description: Get all Resources assigned to a specific Project with pagination.
Get all Resources assigned to a specific Project including the relationship properties.

schema.title: Response Get Project Resources With Relationships Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Resources With Relationships Get

post.description: Assign an Agent as a manager to a Project with relationship properties as defined in TRM Ontology V3.2.

schema.title: Response Assign Manager To Project Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Managers  Agent Id  Post

put.description: Update the relationship properties between an Agent and a Project.

schema.title: Response Update Manager Project Relationship Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Managers  Agent Id  Put

delete.description: Remove the MANAGES_PROJECT relationship between an Agent and a Project.

get.description: Get all Agents managing a specific Project.

schema.title: Response Get Project Managers Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Managers Get

get.description: Get all Agents managing a specific Project including the relationship properties.

schema.title: Response Get Project Managers With Relationships Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Managers With Relationships Get

get.description: Get all subprojects of a specific Project.

schema.title: Response Get Project Subprojects Api V1 Projects  Project Id  Subprojects Get

get.description: Get the parent project of a specific Project, if any.

post.description: Create a new User.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of Users.
Get a specific User by its ID.

delete.description: Delete a User.

get.description: Retrieve paginated tasks for a specific project.

post.description: Create a new task for a project according to Ontology V3.2.

get.description: Get task by ID.

put.description: Update a task according to Ontology V3.2.

delete.description: Delete a task.

post.description:
Assign a task to a user with ASSIGNS_TASK relationship properties.

This follows the TRM Ontology V3.2 specification for ASSIGNS_TASK relationship.

parameters.name: assignment_type

schema.description: Type of assignment: Primary, Supporting, Reviewer, Observer
schema.title: Assignment Type

parameters.description: Type of assignment: Primary, Supporting, Reviewer, Observer

parameters.name: assigned_by

schema.description: User ID of the person making the assignment
schema.title: Assigned By

parameters.description: User ID of the person making the assignment

schema.title: Response Assign Task To User Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  Assign User  User Id  Post

post.description:
Assign a task to an agent with ASSIGNS_TASK relationship properties.

This follows the TRM Ontology V3.2 specification for ASSIGNS_TASK relationship.

parameters.name: assignment_type

schema.description: Type of assignment: Primary, Supporting, Reviewer, Observer
schema.title: Assignment Type

parameters.description: Type of assignment: Primary, Supporting, Reviewer, Observer

parameters.name: assigned_by

schema.description: User ID of the person making the assignment
schema.title: Assigned By

parameters.description: User ID of the person making the assignment

schema.title: Response Assign Task To Agent Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  Assign Agent  Agent Id  Post

get.description:
Get all assignees (users and agents) for a specific task.

If include_relationship_details is True, returns full relationship properties
according to TRM Ontology V3.2.

schema.title: Response Get Task Assignees Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  Assignees Get

post.description:
Accept a task assignment by the assigned user or agent.

Updates the ASSIGNS_TASK relationship with acceptance information.

parameters.name: assignee_id

schema.description: ID of the user or agent accepting the task
schema.title: Assignee Id

parameters.description: ID of the user or agent accepting the task

schema.title: Response Accept Task Assignment Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  Accept Post

post.description:
Mark a task assignment as completed by the assigned user or agent.

Updates the ASSIGNS_TASK relationship with completion information.

parameters.name: assignee_id

schema.description: ID of the user or agent completing the task
schema.title: Assignee Id

parameters.description: ID of the user or agent completing the task

schema.title: Response Complete Task Assignment Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  Complete Post

delete.description: Remove a task assignment (ASSIGNS_TASK relationship) between a task and a user/agent.

schema.title: Response Remove Task Assignment Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  Assignee  Assignee Id  Delete

post.description:
Establish a RESOLVES relationship from a Task to a Tension.
This indicates that the Task was created to resolve this Tension.

According to Ontology V3.2, this creates a bidirectional relationship between Task and Tension.

schema.title: Response Connect Task To Tension Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  Resolves  Tension Id  Post

delete.description: Remove the RESOLVES relationship between a Task and a Tension.

schema.title: Response Disconnect Task From Tension Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  Resolves  Tension Id  Delete

get.description: Get all Tensions that are resolved by a specific Task.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of items to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return

schema.title: Response Get Tensions Resolved By Task Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  Resolves Get

get.description:
Get a comprehensive view of a task with all its relationships loaded.
This endpoint provides a complete picture of the task as defined in Ontology V3.2.

schema.title: Response Get Task With Relationships Api V1 Tasks  Task Id  With Relationships Get

get.description: Get the sources (Projects, RecognitionEvents) connected to a WIN via LEADS_TO_WIN relationship.

schema.title: Response Get Win Sources Api V1 Wins  Win Id  Sources Get

post.description:
Connect a Project to a WIN via LEADS_TO_WIN relationship.

The relationship_data can include:
- contribution_level (int): 1-5 (Minimal to Critical)
- direct_contribution (bool): Whether the contribution was direct
- impact_ratio (float): 0.0-1.0 for impact
- recognition_score (int): 1-100 score
- notes (str): Additional notes

post.description:
Create a new relationship between two entities.

Parameters:
- source_id: The ID of the source entity
- source_type: The type of the source entity
- target_id: The ID of the target entity
- target_type: The type of the target entity
- relationship_type: The type of relationship to create

Returns:
- The created relationship

get.description:
Get relationships for an entity.

Parameters:
- entity_id: The ID of the entity
- entity_type: The type of the entity
- direction: The direction of the relationships (outgoing, incoming, both)
- relationship_type: Optional filter for a specific relationship type
- related_entity_type: Optional filter for a specific related entity type

Returns:
- A list of relationships

schema.title: Response Get Relationships Api V1 Relationships  Get

delete.description:
Delete a relationship between two entities.

Parameters:
- source_id: The ID of the source entity
- source_type: The type of the source entity
- target_id: The ID of the target entity
- target_type: The type of the target entity
- relationship_type: The type of relationship to delete

Returns:
- 204 No Content if successful

post.description:
Create a CREATES_KNOWLEDGE relationship from an entity (User/Agent/Task) to a KnowledgeSnippet.

Parameters:
- source_id: The ID of the entity creating the knowledge
- source_type: The type of entity (User, Agent, or Task)
- knowledge_id: The ID of the KnowledgeSnippet

Returns:
- The created relationship

Create a USES_KNOWLEDGE relationship from an entity (User/Agent/Task) to a KnowledgeSnippet.

Parameters:
- source_id: The ID of the entity using the knowledge
- source_type: The type of entity (User, Agent, or Task)
- knowledge_id: The ID of the KnowledgeSnippet

Returns:
- The created relationship

Create a TRIGGERED_BY relationship to indicate what triggered an entity.

Parameters:
- source_id: The ID of the entity that was triggered
- source_type: The type of entity (e.g., Event, Task, Tension)
- trigger_id: The ID of the entity that triggered it
- trigger_type: The type of the trigger entity (e.g., Event, Task, User)

Returns:
- The created relationship

Create a TRIGGERS relationship to indicate what an entity triggers.

Parameters:
- source_id: The ID of the entity that triggers
- source_type: The type of entity (e.g., Event, Task, User)
- target_id: The ID of the entity that is triggered
- target_type: The type of the triggered entity (e.g., Event, Task, Tension)

Returns:
- The created relationship

Create a RELATED_TO relationship between any two entities.

Parameters:
- source_id: The ID of the source entity
- source_type: The type of the source entity
- related_id: The ID of the related entity
- related_type: The type of the related entity

Returns:
- The created relationship

Create a GENERATES_KNOWLEDGE relationship from a WIN to a KnowledgeSnippet.

Parameters:
- win_id: The ID of the WIN
- knowledge_id: The ID of the KnowledgeSnippet

Returns:
- The created relationship

delete.description:
Delete a GENERATES_KNOWLEDGE relationship between a WIN and a KnowledgeSnippet.

Parameters:
- win_id: The ID of the WIN
- knowledge_id: The ID of the KnowledgeSnippet

Returns:
- 204 No Content if successful

get.summary: Get Knowledge Snippets Generated By Win
get.description:
Get all KnowledgeSnippets generated by a specific WIN.

Parameters:
- win_id: The ID of the WIN

Returns:
- A list of relationships representing knowledge snippets generated by the WIN

schema.title: Response Get Knowledge Snippets Generated By Win Api V1 Relationships Wins  Win Id  Generates Knowledge Get

get.description:
Get all WINs that generate a specific KnowledgeSnippet.

Parameters:
- snippet_id: The ID of the KnowledgeSnippet

Returns:
- A list of relationships representing WINs that generate the knowledge snippet

schema.title: Response Get Wins Generating Knowledge Snippet Api V1 Relationships Knowledge Snippets  Snippet Id  Generated From Wins Get

post.description:
Create a LEADS_TO_WIN relationship from a Project or Event to a WIN.

Parameters:
- source_id: The ID of the source entity (Project or Event)
- source_type: The type of the source entity (must be Project or Event)
- win_id: The ID of the WIN
- relationship_data: Optional properties for the relationship

Returns:
- The created relationship

delete.description:
Delete a LEADS_TO_WIN relationship from a Project or Event to a WIN.

Parameters:
- source_id: The ID of the source entity (Project or Event)
- source_type: The type of the source entity (must be Project or Event)
- win_id: The ID of the WIN

Returns:
- 204 No Content if successful

get.description:
Get all WINs led by a specific Project.

Parameters:
- project_id: The ID of the Project

Returns:
- A list of relationships representing WINs led by the Project

schema.title: Response Get Wins From Project Api V1 Relationships Projects  Project Id  Leads To Wins Get

get.description:
Get all WINs led by a specific Event.

Parameters:
- event_id: The ID of the Event

Returns:
- A list of relationships representing WINs led by the Event

schema.title: Response Get Wins From Event Api V1 Relationships Events  Event Id  Leads To Wins Get

get.summary: Get Projects Events Leading To Win
get.description:
Get all Projects and Events leading to a specific WIN.

Parameters:
- win_id: The ID of the WIN
- source_type: Optional filter for source type (Project or Event)

Returns:
- A list of relationships representing Projects and Events leading to the WIN

schema.title: Response Get Projects Events Leading To Win Api V1 Relationships Wins  Win Id  Led By Get

post.description:
Create a GIVEN_BY relationship from an Agent to a Recognition.

Parameters:
- agent_id: The ID of the Agent
- recognition_id: The ID of the Recognition
- relationship_data: Optional properties for the relationship

Returns:
- The created relationship

delete.description:
Delete a GIVEN_BY relationship between an Agent and a Recognition.

Parameters:
- agent_id: The ID of the Agent
- recognition_id: The ID of the Recognition

Returns:
- 204 No Content if successful

get.description:
Get all Recognitions given by a specific Agent.

Parameters:
- agent_id: The ID of the Agent

Returns:
- A list of relationships representing Recognitions given by the Agent

schema.title: Response Get Recognitions Given By Agent Api V1 Relationships Agents  Agent Id  Gives Recognitions Get

get.description:
Get all Agents that have given a specific Recognition.

Parameters:
- recognition_id: The ID of the Recognition

Returns:
- A list of relationships representing Agents that have given the Recognition

schema.title: Response Get Agents Giving Recognition Api V1 Relationships Recognitions  Recognition Id  Given By Get

post.description:
Create a RECEIVED_BY relationship from a Recognition to an Agent.

Parameters:
- recognition_id: The ID of the Recognition
- agent_id: The ID of the Agent receiving the recognition
- relationship_data: Optional properties for the relationship

Returns:
- The created relationship

delete.description:
Delete a RECEIVED_BY relationship between a Recognition and an Agent.

Parameters:
- recognition_id: The ID of the Recognition
- agent_id: The ID of the Agent

Returns:
- 204 No Content if successful

get.description:
Get all Agents that received a specific Recognition.

Parameters:
- recognition_id: The ID of the Recognition

Returns:

schema.title: Response Get Agents Receiving Recognition Api V1 Relationships Recognitions  Recognition Id  Received By Get

get.description:
Get all Recognitions received by a specific Agent.

Parameters:
- agent_id: The ID of the Agent

Returns:
- A list of relationships representing Recognitions received by the Agent

schema.title: Response Get Recognitions Received By Agent Api V1 Relationships Agents  Agent Id  Received Recognitions Get

post.description:
Create a RECOGNIZES_CONTRIBUTION_TO relationship from a Recognition to a target entity (Project, Task, Resource).

Parameters:
- recognition_id: The ID of the Recognition
- target_id: The ID of the target entity (Project, Task, or Resource)
- target_type: The type of the target entity
- relationship_data: Properties for the relationship

Returns:
- The created relationship

delete.description:
Delete a RECOGNIZES_CONTRIBUTION_TO relationship between a Recognition and a target entity.

Parameters:
- recognition_id: The ID of the Recognition
- target_id: The ID of the target entity (Project, Task, or Resource)
- target_type: The type of the target entity

Returns:
- 204 No Content if successful

get.description:
Get all entities that a specific Recognition recognizes contributions to.

Parameters:
- recognition_id: The ID of the Recognition
- target_type: Optional filter for the type of target entity

Returns:
- A list of relationships representing contributions recognized by the Recognition

schema.title: Response Get Contributions Recognized By Recognition Api V1 Relationships Recognitions  Recognition Id  Recognizes Contributions Get

get.description:
Get all Recognitions that recognize contributions to a specific Project.

- project_id: The ID of the Project

Returns:

schema.title: Response Get Recognitions For Project Contribution Api V1 Relationships Projects  Project Id  Recognized Contributions Get

get.description:
Get all Recognitions that recognize contributions to a specific Task.

Returns:

schema.title: Response Get Recognitions For Task Contribution Api V1 Relationships Tasks  Task Id  Recognized Contributions Get

get.description:
Get all Recognitions that recognize contributions to a specific Resource.

post.description:
Validate entity data against ontology schema and normalize it.

This endpoint takes raw entity data and applies ontology-first validation and normalization.
It returns the normalized data that would be returned by the API, or appropriate error messages.

Args:
    entity_type: The type of entity to validate
    data: The raw entity data to validate
    
Returns:
    The normalized entity data according to ontology

schema.title: Response Validate Entity Data Api V1 Validate Entity  Entity Type  Post

post.description:
Validate and normalize a single enum value.

This endpoint takes an enum type and value and applies ontology-first normalization.
It returns the normalized enum value or appropriate error messages.

Args:
    enum_type: The type of enum to validate (win_status, win_type, etc.)
    value: The enum value to validate
    fallback: Optional fallback value if validation fails
    
Returns:
    The validation result with normalized value or error

schema.title: Response Validate Enum Value Api V1 Validate Enum  Enum Type  Post

name.title: Name
name.description: The unique name of the agent, e.g., 'CodeReviewerAgent'.

agentType.title: Agenttype
agentType.description: Type of the agent. Must be one of: InternalAgent, ExternalAgent, AIAgent, AGE.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.description: The agent's primary function or goal.

description.title: Description
description.description: A brief description of the agent.

status.title: Status
status.description: The operational status of the agent. E.g., 'active', 'inactive', 'error', 'archived'.

capabilities.title: Capabilities
capabilities.description: List of capabilities this agent possesses.

isFounder.title: Isfounder
isFounder.description: Indicates if the agent is a founder.

founderRecognitionAuthority.title: Founderrecognitionauthority
founderRecognitionAuthority.description: Indicates if the founder has recognition authority.

toolIds.title: Toolids
toolIds.description: List of tool IDs this agent is equipped to use.

example.description: The primary founder of The Recognition Machine.
example.name: FounderTRM
example.purpose: To lead and define the vision for TRM.

ProficiencyLevelEnum.title: ProficiencyLevelEnum
ProficiencyLevelEnum.description:
Enum for skill proficiency levels.
1: Beginner - Basic knowledge and limited experience
2: Intermediate - Working knowledge and some practical experience
3: Advanced - Comprehensive knowledge and significant experience
4: Expert - Deep knowledge and extensive experience
5: Master - Complete mastery, recognized authority

Relationship.title: Relationship
Relationship.description:
Pydantic model representing a generic relationship between two nodes as returned by a Cypher query.

Fields:
    source_id: ID of the source node
    source_type: Type of the source node
    target_id: ID of the target node
    target_type: Type of the target node
    type: Type of relationship
    createdAt: Timestamp when the relationship was created
    contributionLevel: Optional level of contribution (1-5) for certain relationship types
    directContribution: Optional boolean indicating if the contribution was direct

RelationshipType.title: RelationshipType
RelationshipType.description: Enum for all possible relationship types in the ontology.

example.currentState: Ontology v3.1 has basic definitions but lacks metadata and concrete examples.
example.description: The current ontology (v3.1) lacks detailed properties, relationships and constraints for core entities. This makes it difficult for AI Agents to accurately understand and automate business processes.
example.desiredState: Ontology v3.2 with detailed definitions, complete constraints, data types, and examples for each entity.
example.impactAssessment: High - Directly impacts ability to develop effective AI Agents and project timeline.
example.title: Ontology missing details for AI Agent implementation
